channel.title: Science : NPR
channel.description: The latest health and science news. Updates on medicine, healthy living, nutrition, drugs, diet, and advances in science and technology. Subscribe to the Health & Science podcast.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2016 NPR - For Personal Use Only

channel.itunes:summary: The latest health and science news. Updates on medicine, healthy living, nutrition, drugs, diet, and advances in science and technology. Subscribe to the Health & Science podcast. http://www.npr.org/sections/science/

item.title: Q&A: What Does The Senate Health Bill Mean For Me?
item.description: June 27, 2017 - The Senate Republicans' plan to overhaul the Affordable Care Act could bring big changes to many Americans' health care coverage. Here are answers to a handful of scenarios from concerned listeners.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: June 27, 2017 - The Senate Republicans' plan to overhaul the Affordable Care Act could bring big changes to many Americans' health care coverage. Here are answers to a handful of scenarios from concerned listeners. http://www.npr.org/sections/health-shots/2017/06/27/534576392/q-a-what-does-the-senate-health-bill-mean-for-me

item.title: Center For Public Integrity Uncovers Safety Hazards At Government Nuclear Labs
item.description: June 27, 2017 - Government labs that house nuclear weapons are rife with workplace safety hazards, a year-long investigation by the Center for Public Integrity finds. NPR's Ari Shapiro talks with Jeff Smith, lead editor of the series "Nuclear Negligence."
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: June 27, 2017 - Government labs that house nuclear weapons are rife with workplace safety hazards, a year-long investigation by the Center for Public Integrity finds. NPR's Ari Shapiro talks with Jeff Smith, lead editor of the series "Nuclear Negligence." http://www.npr.org/2017/06/27/534597167/center-for-public-integrity-uncovers-safety-hazards-at-government-nuclear-labs

item.title: Beekeepers Feel The Sting Of California's Great Hive Heist
item.description: June 27, 2017 - This year authorities uncovered a "beehive chop shop:" nearly $1 million in stolen hives in a field in Fresno County. There's money to be made by renting out bees to orchards, and thefts are rising.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: June 27, 2017 - This year authorities uncovered a "beehive chop shop:" nearly $1 million in stolen hives in a field in Fresno County. There's money to be made by renting out bees to orchards, and thefts are rising. http://www.npr.org/sections/thesalt/2017/06/27/534128664/beekeepers-feel-the-sting-of-california-s-giant-beehive-heist

item.title: Considering Breast-Feeding? This Guide Can Help
item.description: June 27, 2017 - The vast majority of pregnant women in the U.S. say they plan to breast-feed, but aren't told that many new moms worldwide find it tricky. Being mentored the first weeks after birth can help a lot.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: June 27, 2017 - The vast majority of pregnant women in the U.S. say they plan to breast-feed, but aren't told that many new moms worldwide find it tricky. Being mentored the first weeks after birth can help a lot. http://www.npr.org/sections/health-shots/2017/06/27/534123212/considering-breast-feeding-here-s-how-to-make-it-easier

item.title: Degrees of Maybe: How We Can All Make Better Predictions
item.description: June 26, 2017 - Pundits and prognosticators make predictions all the time: about everything from elections, to sports, to global affairs. This week, we explore why they're often wrong, and how we can all do better.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: June 26, 2017 - Pundits and prognosticators make predictions all the time: about everything from elections, to sports, to global affairs. This week, we explore why they're often wrong, and how we can all do better. http://www.npr.org/2017/06/26/534120962/degrees-of-maybe-how-we-can-all-make-better-predictions

item.title: Routine DNA Sequencing May Be Helpful And Not As Scary As Feared
item.description: June 26, 2017 - A study of whole genome sequencing found that while many people discovered genetic variations linked to rare diseases, they didn't overreact to the news.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: June 26, 2017 - A study of whole genome sequencing found that while many people discovered genetic variations linked to rare diseases, they didn't overreact to the news. http://www.npr.org/sections/health-shots/2017/06/26/534338576/routine-dna-sequencing-may-be-helpful-and-not-as-scary-as-feared

item.title: Secrets Of Breast-Feeding From Global Moms In The Know
item.description: June 26, 2017 - Many American women want to breast-feed — and try to. Only about half keep it up. It's like they've lost the instinct. One researcher thinks she's figured out why and how to get the instinct back.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: June 26, 2017 - Many American women want to breast-feed — and try to. Only about half keep it up. It's like they've lost the instinct. One researcher thinks she's figured out why and how to get the instinct back. http://www.npr.org/sections/goatsandsoda/2017/06/26/534021439/secrets-of-breast-feeding-from-global-moms-in-the-know

item.title: Moonwalkers' Apollo 11 Capsule Gets Needed Primping For Its Star Turn On Earth
item.description: June 26, 2017 - In 1969 it was the orbiting home and refuge for the first astronauts who walked on the moon. Today, after decades on display in a Smithsonian museum, the module is being restored for a national tour.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: June 26, 2017 - In 1969 it was the orbiting home and refuge for the first astronauts who walked on the moon. Today, after decades on display in a Smithsonian museum, the module is being restored for a national tour. http://www.npr.org/2017/06/26/533830775/moonwalkers-apollo-11-capsule-gets-needed-primping-for-its-star-turn-on-earth

item.title: Congressman Proposes A Military 'Space Corps'
item.description: June 25, 2017 - NPR's Lulu Garcia-Navarro speaks with Republican Rep. Mike Rogers of Alabama about a bipartisan bill that would create a new part of the military for space operations, called Space Corps.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: June 25, 2017 - NPR's Lulu Garcia-Navarro speaks with Republican Rep. Mike Rogers of Alabama about a bipartisan bill that would create a new part of the military for space operations, called Space Corps. http://www.npr.org/2017/06/25/534286469/congressman-proposes-a-military-space-corps

item.title: 'Interlaced Fingers' Traces Roots Of Racial Disparity In Kidney Transplants
item.description: June 24, 2017 - When Dr. Vanessa Grubbs fell in love with a man whose kidneys were failing, he'd been waiting for a transplant for years. Her book explores the ways racial inequity is embedded in the system.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: June 24, 2017 - When Dr. Vanessa Grubbs fell in love with a man whose kidneys were failing, he'd been waiting for a transplant for years. Her book explores the ways racial inequity is embedded in the system. http://www.npr.org/sections/health-shots/2017/06/24/533966000/interlaced-fingers-traces-roots-of-racial-disparity-in-kidney-transplants

item.title: Arkansas Tries To Stop An Epidemic Of Herbicide Damage
item.description: June 23, 2017 - A weedkiller called dicamba, which farmers hoped could banish herbicide-resistant weeds, has become a plague itself in Arkansas. The state's regulators just voted to ban it for 120 days.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: June 23, 2017 - A weedkiller called dicamba, which farmers hoped could banish herbicide-resistant weeds, has become a plague itself in Arkansas. The state's regulators just voted to ban it for 120 days. http://www.npr.org/sections/thesalt/2017/06/23/534117683/arkansas-tries-to-stop-an-epidemic-of-herbicide-damage

item.title: Mountain Lions Terrified By Voices Of Rush Limbaugh, Rachel Maddow
item.description: June 23, 2017 - Scientists at the University of California, Santa Cruz were trying to understand the nature of fear for mountain lions. By playing a series of audio clips of political talk show hosts, including Rachel Maddow and Rush Limbaugh, researchers discovered that mountain lions fear people.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: June 23, 2017 - Scientists at the University of California, Santa Cruz were trying to understand the nature of fear for mountain lions. By playing a series of audio clips of political talk show hosts, including Rachel Maddow and Rush Limbaugh, researchers discovered that mountain lions fear people. http://www.npr.org/2017/06/23/534143139/mountain-lions-terrified-by-voices-of-rush-limbaugh-rachel-maddow

item.title: 'Cause For Serious Concern': Invasive Carp Caught 9 Miles From Great Lakes
item.description: June 23, 2017 - A commercial fisher captured the silver carp beyond the barriers built to keep the invasive species out of the Great Lakes. The incident is raising alarms from local lawmakers.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: June 23, 2017 - A commercial fisher captured the silver carp beyond the barriers built to keep the invasive species out of the Great Lakes. The incident is raising alarms from local lawmakers. http://www.npr.org/sections/thetwo-way/2017/06/23/534105477/invasive-carp-caught-9-miles-from-great-lakes-in-cause-for-serious-concern

item.title: Could The Best Memory System Be One That Forgets?
item.description: June 23, 2017 - Forget thinking about forgetting as failure. Researchers now say that ridding our brains of irrelevant details and outdated information helps us better navigate our ever-changing world.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: June 23, 2017 - Forget thinking about forgetting as failure. Researchers now say that ridding our brains of irrelevant details and outdated information helps us better navigate our ever-changing world. http://www.npr.org/sections/health-shots/2017/06/23/534001592/could-the-best-memory-system-be-one-that-forgets

item.title: Carrie Poppy: Can Science Reveal The Truth Behind Ghost Stories?
item.description: June 23, 2017 - After visiting a bookstore, Carrie Poppy started feeling odd: pressure on her chest and auditory hallucinations. She thought it was a spirit – until she found another explanation for her symptoms.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: June 23, 2017 - After visiting a bookstore, Carrie Poppy started feeling odd: pressure on her chest and auditory hallucinations. She thought it was a spirit – until she found another explanation for her symptoms. http://www.npr.org/2017/06/23/533791342/carrie-poppy-can-science-reveal-the-truth-behind-ghost-stories
